newsitem.title: JAPAN: IBM Japan to slash wholesale PC prices-report.
newsitem.headline: IBM Japan to slash wholesale PC prices-report.

text.p: IBM Japan Ltd is to slash wholesales prices on personal computers by up to 15 percent to stimulate flagging demand, a major Japanese financial daily reported on Saturday.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun newspaper quoted company officials as saying wholesale prices of desktop models would be cut by 15 percent and notebooks by 10 percent from this weekend.
The firm, a unti of International Business Machines Corp, expected the price cut to trigger a slide in retail prices and stimulate consumer demand, the financial daily reported.

Disappointing sales figures in recent months had compelled IBM Japan to make the drastic price cuts in order to meet its ambitious target of a 30 percent rise in PC shipments this year, the Nihon Keizai quoted company officials as saing.
Overall PC shipments in the quarter April-June were up four percent from the same period last year, the daily quoted the Japan Electronic Industry Development Association as saying.
